title: Patient Demands Immediate Attention
summary: Walk-in patient insists on being seen immediately. Maintain fairness: assess urgency; if not emergency, explain policy and offer soonest slot—fair systems protect trust.

scene.setting: Walk-in patient insists on being seen immediately. You may feel irritated or dismissive; the hidden risk is reacting emotionally and fairness suffering. The decision point is prioritize convenience vs maintain fairness.

beats.narration: The demand is made. The decision point is see them immediately or explain policy.

dialogue.speaker: lead
dialogue.line: Let me understand how urgent this is. If it's not an emergency, our policy is appointments—here's our next available slot.

choices.label: See them immediately and fit them in.

steps.step: True emergency only; clear criteria in policy; document and rare.

leader_lines: Bending once can become the norm. When do we make exceptions?
scripts.closing_line: True emergency only; clear criteria; document and rare.

choices.label: Explain policy respectfully and offer next available slot.

steps.step: Empathy first then policy; offer next available slot; same for everyone.

leader_lines: I hear that you need to be seen. Our policy is appointments—here's our next available slot.
questions: How do we communicate policy without sounding cold?
scripts.closing_line: Empathy first; policy; next slot; same for everyone.

choices.label: Refuse service abruptly and say we're by appointment only.

steps.step: Acknowledge their need; explain why and offer next step; offer to get them on the list.

leader_lines: Abrupt refusal can feel unfair. I want to acknowledge your need—we're by appointment and here's how to get on the list.
How do we say no with respect?
scripts.closing_line: Acknowledge need; explain why; offer next step.

choices.label: Assess urgency; if not emergency, explain policy and offer soonest slot.

steps.step: Quick urgency check; emergency vs can-wait; then policy and next slot.

leader_lines: Let me understand how urgent this is. If it's an emergency we'll triage; otherwise here's our policy and next slot.
Assessing first shows you care; then policy is clear.
scripts.closing_line: Quick urgency check; emergency vs can-wait; policy and next slot.

system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you prioritize convenience or maintain fairness?

outcomes.message: Scheduled patients may wait or feel unfair. Precedent is set for walk-ins.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with explain-policy?

outcomes.message: You were fair and clear. System and trust are protected.
reflection_questions: How do you communicate policy without sounding cold?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I maintained fairness with walk-ins. (1-5)
